reviews.author: Ginchw
reviews.comment_content:
Interesting course cover classical and modern physics from basic topics such as heat and energy, force and gravity and nuclear energy
to E&M, wave, light, quantum physics, universe and relativity.

Very brief in each topics (2~4 lectures) with basic concepts/ formulas. Quiet easy in the first half of the course second half need some time to understand.

End of some lecture will have demonstration. 4 documentaries with PRS questions weighed 10% of final grading.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Interesting. Switching between short video clips and powerpoint to clarify or explain some concepts.

Tutorial will do deeper in some concepts, but no necessary to attend except days of quizzes.
reviews.comment_grading:
4 PRS documentaries 10%
2 quizzes 30%
1 final 60%

Don't miss PRS documentaries, days are listed in sallybus
Quizzed are very easy and open noted, MC+SQ mean is relatively high (>80% in 1st, >70% in 2nd)
Exam in open book with 3 cheat sheets, write all formula in there to shorten time for finding. MC+SQ Very difficult in SQ but mean still high(~68%)

I missed one documentary, 2 quizzes full mark, final above 1 sd and got A-
reviews.comment_workload:
No assignment.

Some exercise and mock papers for you in quizzes/final preparation.

reviews.author: Ade
reviews.title: good grade
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course is literally introductory and very easy to be understood, even for beginners. Also, the quizzes replacing the mid-term exam are less pressurized.
reviews.comment_teaching: The tone of the lecture is quite slow and steady. Furthermore, at the end of lectures, there is a small practical session for all of us to enjoy and experience the nature of physics in a simple way.
reviews.comment_grading: The gradings are released very efficiently and fair
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite relaxed with few pieces of homework and the lack of mid-term

reviews.author: fishball yuen
reviews.comment_content: 大致上係圍繞返以前高中物理的課程，但係範圍好似大過DSE，同時亦都簡單左。雖然好似好多課，但係其實大部份課題自己睇都會明，電力個幾課可能會有d難，但係如果你有朋友讀物理，咁佢應該輕鬆教到你1001入面嘅嘢。而且有時候會有時睇套記錄片，然後問返你入面的問題。
reviews.comment_teaching: 雖然我唔係成日上輝輝堂，但係上輝輝堂係一件開心事，第一個原因係因為輝輝講野好清楚，概念都會解得透。第二個原因就係上堂會有demo比你睇。第三個原因就係輝輝會成日用電影同埋影片去講解返入面關於物理的事。所以上堂唔悶。
reviews.comment_grading: 考final個陣，佢比人帶所有notes同埋自己整的Cheat Sheets，一共4張8版紙，基本上係final個陣記返起之前出過的quiz應該都可以輕輕鬆鬆
reviews.comment_workload: workload唔算大，係兩星期要quiz一次比較麻煩，平時亦冇assignment，不過就算assignment都可以比你帶1張cheat sheet同notes入去考，所以其實都算細workload

reviews.author: jackosn
reviews.title: 再簡單的course都要溫
reviews.comment_content:
total 10個topics, 2堂一個topics
內容都好易明,好多都係basic physics, 只要係4個quiz前有溫過, 完全明哂concept其實唔算太難讀
reviews.comment_teaching: 其實教得唔錯但系無興趣，所以系甘走堂。
reviews.comment_grading:
ok啦.
mean 都幾高。
所以就算open note 都要溫下 先得。
reviews.comment_workload:
無workload
得 quiz 同final. 同 prs.
一定唔可以走quiz. 如果唔系就hihi 啦

reviews.author: iamalannG
reviews.comment_content: 可能因為高中讀過相關內容，臨考文憑試卻決定drop，還好僅有的物理知識足夠應付，open note考試，就是理解量子物理那課題相對困難。
reviews.comment_teaching:
很用心指導學生，會特意找一些科幻電影作為切入點，讓同學上課時，能在課堂上看電影短片而穫得樂趣。
不過教課就是有點慢。
reviews.comment_grading: 不清楚這方面，就是個人是個算術大意的渣渣也能得個B+，check 卷發現自己有計算機的情況下連乘數都算錯。Grade應該不錯吧﹗
reviews.comment_workload: 每四課就有一次Quiz，個人覺得還可以，平日溫習大概總好過臨考試才把考材一次過溫吧﹗

reviews.author: Cat
reviews.title: I chose this for my free elective! (100% not studied phys before)
reviews.comment_content:
The content is quite ''comprehensive'' indeed as many topics like quantum phys, the universe, light, nuclear power........  Given the large number of topics, that means he can only talked a little bit on each topic so the content would not be in depth, he taught energy and power in only 2 lectures, which was too few for DSE physics according to my friends.

I really have not studied phys in my high school (so ppl who have studied but dropped would have an edge :(((((((( but I find the content still manageable (or just manageable)
reviews.comment_teaching: Fai Fai was very nice and willing to answer students' questions :) He had lots of video which helped me learn and interesting as well.
reviews.comment_grading:
Normal grading I would say.
I did not know how ''well'' I performed in 4 quizzes, but I scored an average of 80-85%.
Final I was below 0.5 SD.

I got B-
reviews.comment_workload:
Extremely little since no projects
I spent many time on revising quizzes and final, but I am not the math type so I did not get high marks. In other words my effort did not really pay off. But since I really want to study sth I wanna try, still I gave it a go.

Breakdown:
quizzes (4 in total, total 35%)
final (60%)
prs( 5%, easy)

reviews.author: jes96
reviews.comment_content:
It's about some basic physics content and it's very suitable for students that did not study physics before.
This course is for students with no physics background.

No. of Credits: 3

This course covers topics in:
Principle of scientific theories and methods
Aristotle's law
Newtonian mechanics
Thermal physics
Heat engine
Energy crisis
Global warming
Nature of waves
The physics of hearing and vision
Electricity and magnetism
Electromagnetic waves
Telecommunication
Relativity
Quantum physics
Nuclear energy
Semiconductor developments
Outlook of contemporary physics
reviews.comment_teaching: Both lecture and tutorial is good because they explain the concept clearly.And the documentary session during the lecture can help student have better understanding of the content.
reviews.comment_grading:
It should be good grade since many students can get a A/B range.
The weighting is shown below:
Personal Response System (PRS): 5% (for 4 documentaries)
Bi-weekly Quizzes (held at tutorials): 35% (20 minutes each)
Final Examination (mandatory): 60% (2hr 30min)
* Quizzes: Multiple-choices Questions and Short Questions.

* Final Exam: Multiple-choices Questions and Short Questions.

* Open-notes (non-electronic means); calculator required; Internet access NOT allowed.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload because you only have to go to the PRS quiz lecture and quiz tutorial .

reviews.author: Darth_Will
reviews.comment_content: The depth of the course is basically equivalent to that of senior high school-or-so in Mainland China. (With exception that the cosmology part is a bit deeper, but it won't be a problem.) In this course, calculation and math is NOT the emphasis. Numbers will be made simple so you don't use all your time doing math. They want to induce interest for physics in students from outside SCIE department. So enjoy~
reviews.comment_teaching: Voice is loud and clear (with speaker of course), yet a little soft. Quite a lot of fun experiments and documentaries are used, adding some spices into the course. The instructor and his TA surely do put a lot of effort in it. So, be respectful. If you wanna sleep, OK, but plz don't snore.
reviews.comment_grading: For mainland students, your high school physics is basically enough. Final exam isn't tough, and you are allowed to bring notes. Time is long enough, so don't worry, looking for formulas, facts or anything on site won't cost you leaving paper in blank.
reviews.comment_workload: There are some exercises, but they are only voluntary. Helpful for final review though.

reviews.author: vvv
reviews.comment_content: This course is really about the basic physics, taught in the high school. No calculations needed, just theoretical knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor tries to make his subject as interesting as possible, but his speech is very monotonic, so it is pretty hard to withstand the whole lecture without sleeping.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is not bad as in the Math courses, but usually the mean is about 65-70 on each exam. Moreover, you have to attend the lectures to get another 15% for PRS.
reviews.comment_workload: Easy workload. No assignments, no homework, just two exams. I would suggest just to revise the material after each lecture and it should be fine.

reviews.author: YJ
reviews.comment_content:
總共有10個topic ，兩堂一個，midterm之後有時會播片比你更加明白個topic
其實講真我都而家都唔係好明發生咩事 因為之前無接觸過 讀完之後覺得 phy 好虛無縹緲
差唔多每個topic都會有啲小實驗示範比你睇，同埋有啲戲、電影嘅clip， 之後佢就會開始話段片違反咗啲咩物理定論
不過astron好正 讀完你會覺得宇宙同太空科技好神奇
reviews.comment_teaching:
暉暉真係好風趣幽默（心心眼） 同埋你落堂問佢問題佢都會好有耐性咁答你（話說我聽咗幾次都唔明佢都照解）（其實我有啲鍾意咗個prof，堂堂響度j佢）
上堂好多爛gag好正，仲記得有一次佢無啦啦講 captain law 成班靜咗 然後先解釋話係螺旋槳xdd
如果佢見到成班好眼瞓會好識做咁放幾分鐘break，又會用啲clip或者實驗吸引你注意

TA louis 都好，上tutorial嘅時候會將啲嘢解得好明 ，落堂佢好肯用好多時間解釋你嘅問題 ，有時落堂同佢吹水佢仲會同你講故仔添
reviews.comment_grading:
真係太靚grade啦 A咗
考試嘅問題唔難，但係要諗下，唔太straight-forward,但 只要你堂堂都好專心（當然啦我堂堂都j佢），落堂再問下佢問題 考試啲題目基本上都識做架啦 ，考試openbook 的

prs 問題有啲tricky ，不過淨係計15%， 唔識記得一定要問番佢，如果堂堂都有禁，基本上都穩袋15分

同埋佢之前講過話佢拉curve比成50幾%A，B range
70幾C range 或以上 正正子
reviews.comment_workload:
無功課，得prs 同midterm, final
考試前溫1－2日就ok啦
溫下 notes, tutorial note la

reviews.author: Aglaia Wong
reviews.comment_content: Too easy for student at college level. Wishing for more advanced materials.
reviews.comment_teaching:
A very patient teacher. Gentle and funny. Well-prepared and organized ppt. Interactive teaching with lots of documentaries and demonstrations (Personally I wish that Einstein documentary could be less personal and more academic.) It's always so good to support the theory with instant demos. Great job!

Some TA's English is a bit difficult to follow. But they are actually very eligible ones. You could probably benefit a lot if you ask them questions. :)
reviews.comment_grading: Only be good grade if you are careful enough in the exam. Many think this course is difficult but actually not. Just be more careful while answering exam questions. It's good grade partly because the instructor doesn't follow the ordinary grade distribution.
reviews.comment_workload:
Participation counts! You have to attend lectures and answer questions by PRS to earn the marks. Don't try to skip the lessons as it must be disadvantageous to you if everyone has got their participation scores.

Too light workload. The tutorial session always ends half an hour ahead of official time. Perhaps more exercise questions should be covered in the WS.

reviews.author: Aoi
reviews.comment_content:
總共教10個topic，5個5個咁平均分曬喺midterm前後。
頭1至4個topic都比較簡單，如果你讀過chem完全無新野。
不過之後開始難，基本上有去lecture都唔太會明（其實都唔需要你明，如果你識答題的話）。
reviews.comment_teaching: 好有heart咁教，每堂中間都有幾分鐘break，得閑搞下爛gag又成日睇片睇documentary。
reviews.comment_grading:
BB班好grade是常識吧，Fai Fai佢自己話會努力令大家喺A至B range入面，實際上亦都做到。
無記錯midterm高mean小小，final高1個sd左右，最後有A。
reviews.comment_workload:
接近零workload，不過每堂都有PRS佔15%。
如果你有friend就……
考試係open book，臨考前睇下啲notes知道啲式點樣用就可以了。

reviews.author: Hot and Sexy
reviews.comment_content:
呢個係common core
for一d未讀過phys既人讀
佢既syllabus同dse差唔多

Topic:
1.Heat
2.Force and Motion
3.Light and Wave
4.E&M
5.Relativity

所有topic都只係教得好表面好表面就完
比DSE更簡單
而且佢好少起lecture教計數有者有example
就咁一條式就算

EXAM可以open book and notes
reviews.comment_teaching:
講英文幾好聽
而且有時都會搞下gag

TA全部d英文都好差唔知講咩
唔上好過上
reviews.comment_grading:
每次mid term同final SD都好大
好難高一個sd

有PRS
Mid-term 高0.9x SD
Final = Mean
最後B+
reviews.comment_workload:
乜都唔洗做
除左上堂有PRS

reviews.author: Jules Zhu
reviews.comment_content:
thought it was super boring, I didn't have any interest anyway
lots of ppt and concepts and units
reviews.comment_teaching:
not good not bad
foreman's accent was nice but made you wanna sleep
just common physics things, teaching didn't matter so much I think
results depend on your efforts to memorise all those stuff
reviews.comment_grading:
final grade didn't come out
spent a week to do the review (actually preview) before the final
don't think my final grade would be that bad but at least adequate or average
B- at last
reviews.comment_workload:
no workload
but loads of stuff to memorise...
didn't pay much efforts to do the memorisation things, so almost no workload

reviews.author: Leo11222948
reviews.title: 個人覺得都幾難
reviews.comment_content:
其實我覺得對於完全無sci底的人來講（好似我完全無phy chem bio），個course有d難。我基本上唔返lecture就聽唔明的程度

雖然系phys，但係呢個course完全無野要計，反而系死記為主，中間有d chem野，所以有d唔係好明，但係要應付考試，死記ppt就可以了。

拋開難度問題，其實個內容都幾fun，大部分都係日常野，了解下最新科技，同埋幾個phys大範疇的基本知識。
reviews.comment_teaching:
lecturer系香港local，個人都幾fun，上堂有時會用粵語解釋，講下冷笑話。算系我幾中意的lecturer

TA就真係純碎做下iprs，跟住解釋一下答案甘樣，無咩特別。

溫書記住溫iprs同埋pratice question。 Final exam 會出返，有時會改少少，有時會完全一樣。
reviews.comment_grading:
Lecture participation  10%  (by participation)

Tutorials（start from Tutorial No.2）15% + 15% (by participation + correctness)

Final Examination 60%

Me
Lecture 10
Tutorial (participation 15 correctness ~12)
Final unknown
Grade A-
我想講，唔知點解Tutorial d人好似好勁，基本上每題好似都係得幾個人錯（in 60-80個人），好似淨系得我覺得佢d問題好難......有d堂上完全無聽過，大部分人照樣答對，其實系米我太廢.......
reviews.comment_workload:
完全無assignment同埋mid term

Workload 看似好少，淨系得Final exam，但係其實佢計每堂lecture 同埋tutorial的iprs，其實即系計attendence…不過宜家有zoom上都算系方便d（雖然個人建議返lecture，專心d，易d明）

reviews.author: BennyBenny
reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment_content:
01 Physics and the Modern Society
02 Energy
03 Entertainment and Daily Application
04 New materials and physics
05 Microscopy and Nontechnology
06 Information Technology
07 Environmental Issues
08 Medical Applications
09 Disasters
10 Universe
11 The Future and Unsolved Problems
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite clear but a bit boring.
reviews.comment_grading: Quite good, you just need to have a revision before having tutorial, then you can get full marks in the iPRS questions. And the exam only involves MC . You just need to recite all the PowerPoint slides then you can get very high scores and that is how I get A- in this course.
reviews.comment_workload: Extremely light. No homework,Only exam.

reviews.author: jerry_nguyen
reviews.comment_content:
History, Methodology and Bird View
Energy
Documentary: The Story of Energy / BBC
Entertainment and Various Daily Applications
New Materials and Physics
Microscopy and Nanotechnology
Information Technology and Physics
Documentary: The Story of Information / BBC
Environmental Issues
Medical Applications
Disasters
Universe and Cosmology
Future and Unsolved Problems
reviews.comment_teaching:
Quite boring, and with many theories.

The professor shows efforts in teaching but his voice is boring, and he tends to skip slides when running out of time.

The content is good but the teaching is really bad.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% participation
15% + 15% quiz
Final 60%
reviews.comment_workload: Not really much, but should prepare before if you don't want to study too much on final exam.

reviews.author: Daniel's
reviews.title: Interesting course with no math
reviews.comment_content:
Course outline:
New materials
Microscopy and Nanotechnology  
Information technology and physics
Energy issues
Entertainment
Household Applications
Medical
Environmental issues
Disasters
General introduction and future outlook of PHYSICS.

- most of the content are related to our daily life (e.g. refrigerator, MRI, X ray, superconductor, Nuclear plant...)  
- NO calculation in the Final or polling question.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Li is nice and patience, he understands that some topic is difficult for us and is willing to spend more time to explain the concept to us. Though sometimes he spends too much time answering students question and overrun a little bit.

Also he's done a very good job in explaining the concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
The exam was open notes(hard copy only)
consist of 70 question (40 single choice MC, 30 multiple choice MC)
90 minutes
Don't know our score in Final
In the end I got a pretty Good grade
reviews.comment_workload:
50% Final
20% Tutorial attendance
20% Tutorial result
10% Polling (in lesson) result

- The tutorial is quit useful, it forces us to understand the lecture material weekly. only 10 question per week

reviews.author: byngshn69
reviews.comment_content:
- History, Methodology and Bird View (2 Lectures)
- Energy (2 Lectures)
- Documentary: The Story of Energy (1 Lecture)
- Entertainment and Various Daily Applications (4 Lectures)
- New Materials and Physics (2 Lectures)
- Microscopy and Nanotechnology (2 Lectures)
- Information Technology and Physics (2 Lectures)
- Documentary: The Story of Information (1 Lecture)
- Environmental Issues (1 Lecture)
- Medical Applications (2 Lectures)
- Disasters (2 Lectures)
- Universe and Cosmology (Guest Lecture)
- Future and Unsolved Problem (1 Lecture)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Pretty straightforward and easy to follow. No attendance for lectures, only tutorials. Lecture videos will be uploaded on canvas.
There were some documentaries which you can find on Youtube, and also a guest lecture which was also uploaded to canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
Never came to the lectures and still got a satisfactory grade. Pretty good I guess.

Don't really need to come to the lectures, you can study on your own from the ppt and if you have any difficulties understanding you can check lecture videos or google.

30% Tutorials (by attendance)
70% Finals : 55 questions 1 hour (open book including powerpoints)

The questions on the finals were pretty straightforward and most of them are included in the ppt (except a few questions which require you to think a bit). Some questions were also taken directly from the tutorial notes.

Attended all tutorials, scores for the finals not yet released. Got an A
reviews.comment_workload: No workload at all. Just come to the tutorials which will only last about 30 minutes. Tutorials count for 30% of your final grade.

reviews.author: misky
reviews.title: Good grade course
reviews.comment_content: Some really basic concept of physics. No calculation is required. Only need to understand the concept or theories. Even someone without any physics or science background can understand the content with ease.
reviews.comment_teaching: Online video is provided and no attendance for lesson is required.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance for tutorial and final(55mc questions).
The exam is pretty easy as long as you understand the concept of the content thoroughly. I have zero background in physics. I guess I have less than 3 questions wrong for the final(mark not released). Get an A.
reviews.comment_workload:
Attend the tutorials.
Recite the notes.
Zero workload before exam as no hw or quiz etc.
However, it may be quite time-consuming to understand all the content in the notes and prepare for exam.

reviews.author: mgc
reviews.comment_content:
Just some simply physics
Cover various topics but not in depth
reviews.comment_teaching:
To be honest quite boring,
just attended first few lessons.
Also not necessary at all, just go through the slide by yourself.
reviews.comment_grading:
tutorial - 30% (By attendance)
final exam - 70% (all MC questions)

Almost everyone would get all the 30% tutorial attendance, so don't miss any of them. And some of the exam questions will be exactly the same from the tutorial worksheet.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very low during the semester since no assignment and no mid-term exam. But to get good grade you have to put quite a lot efforts to memorize all the slides.

reviews.author: KST
reviews.comment_content: 咩都有啲，由physics基礎理論到實際應用都有，醫療、地震、量子力學、核能都有講，不過全部都係資料性，唔洗計數。我從未接觸過physics，都可以明白啲內容。
reviews.comment_teaching:
幾無聊下，professor都係跟住powerpoint讀，lecture唔take attendance，但係tutorial會take。
上左幾堂之後就冇再去。
reviews.comment_grading:
合理grade
付出相等於收穫，如果想攞高分一定要預時間背ppt
final exam 70%
tutorial attendance 30%，堂堂有去交worksheet就滿分

final exam 110條mc左右，大部分都係考記性，有溫有背就好快搞掂，唔識就求其撞

考試都係1個鍾左右搞掂，時間相當充裕
最後冇講幾分，我背左8-9成攞A
reviews.comment_workload:
0 workload，冇assignment，冇midterm，冇project，得final exam
tutorial啲worksheet會當場自己對答案

reviews.author: IPJ
reviews.comment_content:
1. Energy ⭐⭐⭐
- Mechanical Energy (Potential Energy, Kinetic Energy, Work-Energy Theorem)
- Conservation of Energy
- Sources of Energy (Solar, Wind, Tidal, Geothermal, Hydrogen, Plasma)
- Nuclear Power (Fission, Fusion, Nuclear Reactors, Mass-Energy Equivalence)

This chapter is a bit difficult when it comes to plasma and nuclear power, which constitute around half of the chapter.

2. Daily Applications (A) ⭐⭐⭐⭐
- Thermodynamics
Application 1: Heat Engine (e.g. Internal Combustion Engine)
Application 2: Heat Pumps (e.g. Refrigerator and Air-con)

- Electromagnetism
。Electric charge (Applications: Photocopiers, laser printers, 3d printers)
。Capacitors (Applications: RAM, Touch Screens, Supercapacitor bus)
。Electromagnetic Induction (Applications: Transformers, Inductive Charging, Electric Guitar, Motors, Generators, Hybrid Automobiles, Maglev)

As a physics beginner, I took several days to at least understand what all the text in the slides of this chapter is talking about. Not easy at all.

3. Daily Applications (B) ⭐⭐⭐⭐
- Mechanics
。Acceleration (Application: MEMS)
。Oscillation (Application: Electronic Clocks)

- Optics
。Polarization (Application: 3D-Viewing, LCD)

- Modern Physics
。Photoelectric effect (Application: CCD)
。Molecules and Condensed Matters (Application: LED, OLED)
。Atoms
    1. Laser (Application: Holography)
    2. Atomic clocks (Application: GPS)

Same as the previous chapter, I took many efforts to understand what the fuck is going on.

4. Medical Applications⭐⭐⭐
- Waves
。Sound waves (Application: Ultrasound Imaging)

- Optics
。Fiber optics (Application: Endoscopy)

- Modern Physics
。Laser (Application: LASIK, PRK)
。X-ray (Application: X-ray Imaging, CAT)
。Pair Annihilation (Application: PET)
。NMR (Application: MRI)

As time passed by, the chapters of Ng Yee Fai part became easier. For this chapter, X-ray, pair annihilation and NMR are the more difficult parts, comprising a large portion of the chapter. But at least, way easier to understand compared to daily applications!

5. Disasters⭐⭐⭐
- Stellar Impact (e.g. Comet Shoemaker-Levy 9, the Cretaceous extinction, The Chelyabinsk Asteroid, The Yunnan Fireball, A/2017 U1)

- Earthquake (Seismic waves, Earth's internal layers, earthquake causes, magnitude scales)

- Nuclear weapons
。Atomic bombs (Little Boy, The Gadget, Fat Man)
。Hydrogen Bomb (Fusion Bomb)
。Aftermath of nuclear explosions

- Nuclear Reactor Accidents (The Three Mile Island Accident, The Chernobyl Accident, The Fukushima Accident)

Largely related to the chapter of Energy (the first chapter listed). The earthquake and nuclear weapon parts are relatively difficult, composing a large part of this chapter.

6. Environmental Issues ⭐⭐
a. Solar Radiation
b. Greenhouse Effect
c. The Keeling Curve
d. Global Warming
e. Carbon footprint

The easiest chapter, throughout the WHOLE COURSE, because they are mainly senior level Geography stuff, with less details.

Each chapter has a slide of around 80-100 pages. Some of the pages are just video, pictures and demonstrations, but most of them will be wordy contextual details.

Lin Nian part:
1. Introduction⭐
Shit intro.

2. New Material and Physics ⭐⭐⭐⭐

Current Materials
- Silicon
(Application: PN-junction diode, PNP-junction transistor)
- Carbon (Graphite and Graphene)
(Application: Flexible display, graphene nanoribbons, carbon nanotube)

Future Materials
- Metamaterials (Invisible cloaking, negative refractive index)
- Quantum materials (Quantum hall effect)

Supplement: Superconductors

3. Microscopy and Nanotechnology⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Microscopy
- History
- Properties of light (EM wave, diffraction)
- X-ray crystallography
- Double-slit experiment
- Scanning Electron Microscopy
- Transmission Electron Microscopy
- Quantum tunneling effects (Application: Scanning Tunneling Microscopy)
- Atomic force microscopy

Nanotech
- Definition
- Damascus
- Properties at nanometer scale (subatomic scale)
  Example: Gold
- Quantum confinement
- Application: sunscreens
- Quantum Dot displays
- Nano-fabrication (Lithography: E-beam, Focused Ion beam, Molecular beam epitaxy)

4. Information Technology and Physics ⭐⭐⭐⭐
- Magnetic data storage
。Magnetism (Spin, Curie Temperature, Magnetic domains, etc.)
。Data Storage (GMR, TMR, MTJ)

- Quantum computer
。Uncertainty Principle
。Particle and Wave Duality
。Superposition
。Qubit
。Advantages of quantum computer

- Quantum communication
。quantum entanglement

5. Future and Unsolved Problems⭐
Quantum gravity, particle masses, quantum measurement, turbulence, dark energy, dark matter, complexity, matter-antimatter asymmetry, friction, arrow of time

Just some brief introduction to the above unsolved problems and ending of the course.

I had many question marks on my head whenever I took a seat in Lin Nian's lecture. I could not even understand his notes. Of course they are more concise than Ng Yee Fai's, but the notes gave no explanation (just some random combinations of description, pictures and mathematical equations).

"Ahhhhhh..... Mathematics is intrinsically fucking beautiful......"

====GUEST LECTURES====

Liu Tao: Elementary Particles and Standard Model
?????????????????????????????????????????????

Wang Yi: Universe and Cosmology
I can say I know what is going on, but I cannot say so either.......

Two documentaries:
- The Big Bang Machine
- Into the Universe with Stephen Hawking

Long documentaries. I think I do not really love physics (or science). I found the documentaries uninteresting, but sure, way more understandable than the NOTES of the guest lectures.
reviews.comment_teaching: Fair
reviews.comment_grading:
mainly focus on Final exam
coz everyone can get the 30% Tutorial Attendance.
70% on final, MC only
the grade is DEFINETLY NOT GOOD.
reviews.comment_workload: No workload, only have to attend tutorial.

reviews.author: Dreamscometrue
reviews.title: Physics is not something easy
reviews.comment_content:
Dse physics content which are quite difficult starting from EM.

Some students who dropped physics in dse can take the course. They must have known more.

Last few chapters are about universe and relativity, I found that must more interesting than the previous ones.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Fai fai teaching is fair, he tries to make the lecture more interesting by doing some experiments and making jokes. Well, the general atmosphere is still boring. He speaks very very slow so there would not be difficulties in understanding. One point that I don't like is that he always uses some advanced words which we may not understand. More clarification should be better. Overall, his teaching is satisfactory.

For the tutorial, Jerry reintroduced the concepts from the very beginning, so it is easier for us beginners to learn. But remember to sit in the front or you can see nothing. His words are tiny.
reviews.comment_grading:
Normal, relatively poorer than business school.

Midterm above mean for more than 1 sd
Final above mean for 1.3 sd

Eventually get an A-, definitely not as good grade as mentioned. May it's good in science good already.
reviews.comment_workload:
No homework
2 quizzes
1 difficult final exam
PRS quiz for 5 documentaries

=> low workload

Note: quizzes and exam are CLOSED book in this semester and I think also for the coming semesters. You can bring 1 cheatsheet to quizzes and 3 to final exam.

reviews.author: LSJU
reviews.title: sb common core，sb学校，不愧是top60，朝令夕改，非常失望。香港科技大学最垃圾的课程，没有之一
reviews.comment_content:
覆盖范围很广，深度很浅。说白了就是文科物理。建议理科生别报。

common core纯纯脑瘫，没有屌用，就是为了恶心学生。26届学生刚入学就tm改制度，往届的所有cc26届学生学了都不算。问题是傻逼学校你他妈新课都没有改出来就他妈取消之前的课程的认可，让26届学生学什么？啊？
结果硬是空了一个学期，spring term才出26届学生可以认可的CORE1110。那你他妈改就改吧，现在23年又改回PHYS1001是什么脑瘫？朝令夕改是吧？现在23年改回了PHYS1001，标题内容都跟之前的PHYS1001一模一样，但是还是不认22年fall term的PHYS1001。要我看，傻逼科大就是没自信，自己都不承认自己的课程。编课程的人也是小脑萎缩，想到哪改到哪，不管学生怎么想
建议以后大家都大四再上ccc，以防sb科大像今年一样，一个学期改一次课程，以后大家在毕业前上的ccc全都不承认，回头影响毕业。
reviews.comment_teaching:
上课基本就是读ppt。自学也差不多。但必须出勤因为要计attendance。

FOREMAN也是个纯脑瘫的教授。自己教学跟shit一样，还强迫学生出勤。这学期貌似是他最后一次教PHYS1001，而且PHYS1001之后也要改成CORE1110了，于是他也开始恶心学生。设立了一堆莫名其妙的评分标准，极大程度地增加了学生的工作量，给龟却没有一点变好，出鬼后我跟他argue，说他给龟烂，而且我们这个学期的工作量几倍多于往届，应该给我们更好的龟。他却给我说，‘我也认为你在这门课上的表现非常的好，所以我给了你很好的成绩，我认为B+是非常好地成绩。而且你不应该跟其他届的学生对比。’我直接。。。。真tm给我干无语了。头一次见这种给烂龟还理直气壮的脑瘫。
reviews.comment_grading:
算的真花，什么都计。不知道按照什么比例给的龟，给的很烂

我下学期去学了PHYS1112直接拿了A+，这门文科课真就纯傻逼，建议以后改成Arts common core
reviews.comment_workload: 看个人。对我来说很大，但属于出力不讨好的那种。总而言之，就是这课不值。本学期是这课存在的最后一个学期。就这教授还突然加难度和工作量。感觉很坑，比往届学生相比工作量大多了。但给的龟没有变好。反而感觉给的更差了。

reviews.author: Sofy Twilight
reviews.title: Just recite more! As well as understanding.
reviews.comment_content:
The content is actually quite wide.
From energy, application of physics in material science, entertainment, medication, and disater as well as cosmology. And most importantly... Quantum Physics! All covered. But don't worry as this is just an introduction, won't involve much computation. But just understand some of the principles make them work, that's all. If you understand them, you will have a good result. Tbh the topics are quite interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: During the add-drop period the teaching is good... Those funny experiments.. But after that, the teaching is not that good, he often just read the powerpoint, and did not leave much time for us to think. So you may have to understand those topics by yourselves after the lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation (Answering IPRS in the lectures) : 10%
Tutorial(Answering IPRS in the tutorial sessions): 15% for clicking "Submit" + 15% for correct answers
Final: 60% Answering 90 MCQs
I earned all Participation and Tutorial marks, and I think I made 4-6 mistakes in the 90 MCQs. And the final grade turned to A-, well that's pretty Ok. I heard that the curve is quite strict as many performed well.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much, you just have to spend time to understand the lectures.

reviews.author: LLLEE
reviews.title: If work harder can get an A
reviews.comment_content: -Basically the course covers some history of physics, some physics concepts (e.g. Energy, Magnetism, Quantum mechanics etc.) and some applications in daily life which have applied the physics theories.
reviews.comment_teaching:
-Every lecture will be recorded.
-I attended session L1 which was taught by Ng Yee Fai (generally I think he teaches better than FOREMAN, Bradley Alan, who was the lecturer of session L2).
-However, the lecture videos were filmed in L2.
-So, it is better if you can attend the lecture in person if you are enrolled in L1.
reviews.comment_grading:
-my grade: A-
-the final score for the exam is not released so I can't tell any mean, SD, and cut-off
-but if you did revise, attend lectures and make sure you understand every concept, I think A range is guaranteed

**reminder: PLS watch all the BBC documents (3 only) and jot notes for that if you want an A grade
reviews.comment_workload: -Light compare to other major-specific courses only if you think understanding the concepts and attending lectures are the basic.

reviews.author: Luftmensch
reviews.title: Easy Physics
reviews.comment_content: Simple physics theories were involved in the course and no calculation is needed which is friendly to students who have not study physics.  Teaching is not only based on lecture notes but some documentary video will be played to provide more detail information about the physics concept, which I think is comprehensive for students understand those theories deeper.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Ng is a gentleman with a very soft voice and patient teaching. He is very welcome students to ask question and he will answer you patiently with some additional informations which allows me to have a better understanding. Also he is very passionate to physics and the passion to physics did attribute my interests to physics.
reviews.comment_grading: Some of the MC questions in exam are extracted from tutorial exercises therefore if students revise tutorial questions it can ensure a fair grading.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload of this subjects is very small, only one to two assignments. Mid-term and final exams are both MC questions.

reviews.author: GPA 2.7小隊
reviews.title: Shit course and extremely boring prof.
reviews.comment_content:
PHYS1001 (L1, L2) - Physics and the Modern Society

General Description:

This course is for students with no physics background.

Exclusion: Level 3 or above in HKDSE 1/2x Physics or HKDSE 1x Physics; any PHYS courses at 1100-level or above.

No. of Credits: 3

Topics covered in this course: Principle of scientific theories and methods, Aristotle's law, Newtonian mechanics, thermal physics, heat engine, energy crisis, global warming, nature of waves, the physics of hearing and vision, electricity and magnetism, electromagnetic waves, telecommunication, relativity, quantum physics, nuclear energy, semiconductor, developments and outlook of contemporary physics.
reviews.comment_teaching: bad
reviews.comment_grading: Bad
reviews.comment_workload: no workload but iprs

reviews.comment_content:
Content is organized into different modules:
Entertainment and Various Daily Applications
New Materials and Physics
Microscopy and Nanotechnology
Information Technology and Physics
Environmental Issues
Medical Applications
Disasters
Universe and Cosmology
Future and Unsolved Problems

Physics without any mathematics whatsoever, making it difficult to understand the theories behind. Basically became ppt-reciting course.

Below is the list of taught topics:
Principle of scientific theories and methods
Aristotle's law, Newtonian mechanics
Thermal physics, heat engine, energy crisis, global warming, nuclear energy
Nature of waves, the physics of hearing and vision
Electricity and magnetism, electromagnetic waves, telecommunication
Relativity, quantum physics
Semiconductor
Developments and outlook of contemporary physics
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Foreman reads directly from the ppt, and doesn't really help explain the concepts.
The dry content, combined with his monotone voice, induces sleep rather quickly.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% after-lecture iPRS (By participation)
15% tutorial participation
15% tutorial iPRS correctness
60% final exam

2 lecture marks and 1 tutorial mark won't be counted.
reviews.comment_workload:
Nearly no workload.

Just show up to the tutorial and briefly read through the ppt to answer the easy iPRS questions.

Might need to cram heavily before final though.
Final is MC only.

reviews.author: DrainGang
reviews.title: EXTREMELY easy and boring
reviews.comment_content:
History, Methodology and Bird View
Energy
Documentary: The Story of Energy / BBC (video)Links to an external site.
Entertainment and Various Daily Applications
New Materials and Physics
Microscopy and Nanotechnology
Information Technology and Physics
Documentary: The Story of Information / BBC
Environmental Issues
Medical Applications
Disasters
Universe and Cosmology
Future and Unsolved Problems

Very boring, but easy as half of them are common sense, if you have any BASIC understanding of technology and science you would know even more of the course content without attending the lectures. Also despite being a physics course, there is NO calculations to be done, over the semester I have learnt 0 equations, so for students who may be not the best at math, no worries.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Boring lectures, Professor Foreman does try to spice things up with live experiments and some interactive simulations, but the contents of the course, and his monotone delivery made for boring lectures, and considering how basic the contents in the course is, you really don't need to attend them.

As for the tutorials, you have to attend them, as it is part of the grade, and again, its very boring. The lecture consists of you doing 10 multiple choice questions for 30 minutes, and you would finish them by like 5 minutes. Or you can choose to not do them at all because right after those 30 minutes, the TA gives you all the answers! I forgot the name of my TA but she could barely speak English, but it really doesn't matter because you can just look at the powerpoints to figure out the answers yourself.
reviews.comment_grading:
Tutorials and 1 final exam.

The details are quite complicated due to the circumstances of this semester.

Tutorials: Boring. Explained in Teaching

Final exam: Online, open book, and MCs only. You can look up EVERY question as the exam questions have the exact same wording as the powerpoints, so you can look up everything and get the exact answer in a matter of seconds. 7 students were chosen after the exam for a oral exam where the professors asked them questions to make sure they understood the course content and didn't look everything up, so if you think you are very unlucky you should study a bit for it. I was luckier and did not need to do the oral exam. My score was not shown but I got an A-, so I am very happy with the course grade considering how little I did.
reviews.comment_workload: Literally NO workload, take maybe like a few hours to study for the finals. Knowing the vague ideas and whereabouts of those ideas in the powerpoint would help with looking up the answers in the exams quite a lot.
